snippet: What should the United States do to encourage high-tech manufacturing, or are those jobs not worth it pursuing?
abstract: What should the United States do to encourage high-tech manufacturing, or are those jobs not worth it pursuing?

headline.main: Should the U.S. Seek More Tech Manufacturing?

snippet: In the last year, the initial public offerings of once obscure security start-ups have outperformed the offerings from household names like Facebook and Zynga.
abstract: Initial public offerings of once obscure computer security start-ups in the last year have outperformed offerings from household names like Facebook and Zynga; big companies are expected to spend $32.8 billion on computer security in 2012, up 9 percent from 2011; rise of security start-ups is fueled by new technology, fear, and wealthy investors.

headline.main: Security Start-Ups Catch Fancy of Investors
headline.print_headline: Security Start-Ups Catch Fancy Of Investors

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and EVELYN M. RUSLI

snippet: The Capitol Theater in Port Chester, N.Y. — known as a rock stage where acts like the Grateful Dead and Janis Joplin have performed — is set to reopen Sept. 4 after a $2 million renovation by Peter Shapiro.
abstract: Capitol Theater in Port Chester, NY, is set to reopen after a $2 million renovation by Peter Shapiro; theater is known as a rock stage with great acoustics, where acts like the Grateful Dead and Janis Joplin have performed.

headline.main: A Hall Full of Memory Rocks Out Once More
headline.print_headline: A Hall Full Of Memory Rocks Out Once More

snippet: Apple, by going to a jury trial to defend the patents of its most prized products, is allowing competitors and the public to see inside one of the most secretive companies in the world.
abstract: Apple, by going to a jury trial to defend the patents of its most prized products, is allowing competitors and the public to see inside one of the most secretive companies in the world.

headline.main: Disruptions: At Its Trial, Apple Spills Some Secrets

snippet: Before the opening rounds of the 100- and 400-meter track and field races at the London Games, the world’s fastest men take stock of what they consume right before they race.
abstract: World's fastest men take stock of what they consume before they compete in track and field races at the London Olympics.

headline.main: Before Sprints at Olympic Track, Sitting Down at the Table
headline.print_headline: Smorgasbord Of Oddities, Beginning At Breakfast

snippet: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley.
New applications can help diners locate a meal, and make sure that certain someone pays what he owes.
abstract: App City column on mobile apps Foodspotting, BiteHunter and Foodivide, all of which help users choose restaurants, find deals and split up the check.

headline.main: Tricks to Finding Food and to Paying for It
headline.print_headline: Tricks to Finding Food And to Paying for It

snippet: British officials are raising taxes on foreign buyers of high-end properties, possibly burnishing New York’s reputation as a safe harbor for expatriate millionaires.
abstract: Big Deal column; British officials are raising taxes on the purchase of high-end properties in England by foreign buyers; shift could make New York City property even more desirable as a safe harbor for expatriate millionaires.

headline.main: In London, Taxes Rise. Will Buyers Flee to New York?
headline.print_headline: In London, Taxes Rise. Will Buyers Flee to New York?

snippet: SAN JOSE, Calif. - Back in the early 1930s, a magician by the name of Horace Goldin went to court to defend his signature illusion: sawing a woman in half.     Mr. Goldin filed a lawsuit against the R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Company for using this ma...
abstract: Nick Bilton Disruptions column contends Apple, by presenting evidence in a patent lawsuit against Samsung Electronics, is allowing competitors and the public to see inside one of the most secretive companies in the world; holds Apple could risk losing some of its magic by showing how it designs products that twice radically changed the electronics industry. (M)

headline.main: Disruptions: At a Trial, Apple Spills Some Secrets
